column12: This new library building replaces the two branches which served Billingham - one close by in the town centre (Rosebery Library) and one in the older part of the community about a mile away.  Both were closed in December 2014 and the new building opened in January 2015.  The library is co-located with a Council Customer Contact Centre and with Billingham Town Council.

This library is currently under Review and is proposed for closure during 2016/2017. Yarm Library is currently under refurbishment as a "town centre hub library" and will re-open on September 5th 2016.

This library is currently under Review and is proposed for closure if a co-location opportunity cannot be found. column3: Redhill Children's Centre, Redhill Rd., Roseworth, Stockton-on-Tees

column2: Stockton Central Library and Customer Service Centre
column12: Stockton Central Library was refurbished in 2011 when it was closed for several months for a complete re-modelling and refit of the building.  The new library incorporates the largest of the Council's Customer Contact Centres as well as a publicly available meeting space and small gallery area.  The main areas of the library are split into a separate, flexible adult and children's lending space, dedicated information and local history library and family history centre.  The library was opened in 1967 and the original structure has been enhanced by the alterations and re-modelling.  This service point is designated as one of our "town centre hub" libraries. This library's refurbishment was in excess of Œ£50K
